summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence from July 2023 between attorney Jeanne M. Christensen and an unnamed federal prosecutor. Christensen urges the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to investigate Leon Black based on new information about his $62.5 million settlement with the U.S. Virgin Islands and allegations he sexually assaulted multiple women. The emails coordinate a call to discuss the matter.

persons.name: Jeanne M. Christensen
persons.context: Attorney who initiates the correspondence, urging the U.S. Attorney's Office to investigate Leon Black based on new financial settlement information and allegations of sexual assault.

persons.name: Leon Black
persons.context: Financier and former Apollo Global Management CEO. The email alleges he paid $62.5 million to the U.S. Virgin Islands and sexually assaulted multiple women, prompting a call for criminal investigation.

persons.name: Jane
persons.context: Person who passed along Jeanne Christensen's initial email to the federal prosecutor.

connections.description: Christensen is an attorney advocating for a criminal investigation into Black based on allegations of sexual assault and a financial settlement.
Jane acted as an intermediary, passing Christensen's email to the federal prosecutor.

events.title: Reuters reports Leon Black's USVI settlement
events.description: Reuters reports that Leon Black settled with the U.S. Virgin Islands for $62.5 million over Epstein-related matters.

events.title: Christensen emails prosecutor about Black
events.description: Attorney Jeanne M. Christensen sends an email to a federal prosecutor urging investigation of Leon Black based on the new settlement information and allegations he sexually assaulted multiple women.

events.title: Coordination of call regarding Black investigation
events.description: Email exchange between Christensen and a prosecutor to schedule a phone call to discuss the Leon Black matter.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY
keyFacts: Attorney Jeanne M. Christensen alleges Leon Black paid $62.5 million to the U.S. Virgin Islands in a settlement related to Epstein.
Christensen states she has heard one lawyer represents ten women who allege Leon Black sexually assaulted them.
Christensen urges the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to pursue criminal charges against Black based on this new information.
The correspondence reveals the Civil Rights Unit at SDNY was handling all trafficking matters as of July 2023.
The email chain shows active coordination between a private attorney and federal prosecutors to discuss potential investigation of a high-profile financier.
